p: Cytotoxicity assay revealed that S. aromaticum essential oil did not exhibit toxicity for BALB/c peritoneal macrophages even at the highest concentration analyzed (2,000 μg/mL). Eugenol displayed greater cytotoxicity than S. aromaticum essential oil, directly influencing its selectivity index. Thus, although eugenol exhibited better activity against intracellular amastigotes, S. aromaticum essential oil exhibited a higher SI value ( Table 3).
